Measure Registry

Source: R/measures.R
measures.Rd

The environment() measures keeps track of all measures in this package. It stores meta information such as minimum, maximum or if the measure must be minimized or maximized.

measures

Format

An object of class environment of length 52.

Examples

names(measures)

#>  [1] "mauc_au1p"   "tp"          "fbeta"       "fnr"         "mbrier"     
#>  [6] "bacc"        "ktau"        "maxse"       "mape"        "maxae"      
#> [11] "mauc_au1u"   "ce"          "ppv"         "sensitivity" "specificity"
#> [16] "recall"      "fn"          "precision"   "srho"        "fp"         
#> [21] "bbrier"      "tpr"         "bias"        "acc"         "mcc"        
#> [26] "auc"         "rae"         "rrse"        "smape"       "rse"        
#> [31] "npv"         "mauc_aunp"   "rsq"         "fomr"        "fdr"        
#> [36] "fpr"         "dor"         "tnr"         "pbias"       "logloss"    
#> [41] "prauc"       "mae"         "mauc_aunu"   "rmsle"       "rmse"       
#> [46] "medse"       "sse"         "medae"       "msle"        "sae"        
#> [51] "mse"         "tn"         
measures$tpr

#> $id
#> [1] "tpr"
#> 
#> $type
#> [1] "binary"
#> 
#> $title
#> [1] "True Positive Rate"
#> 
#> $lower
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $upper
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $predict_type
#> [1] "response"
#> 
#> $minimize
#> [1] FALSE
#>
